metadata.title: CVE-2019-9787 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 5.1.1 does not properly filter comment content, leading toRemote Code Execution by unauthenticated users in a default configuration.This occurs because CSRF protection is mishandled, and because SearchEngine Optimization of A elements is performed incorrectly, leading to XSS.The XSS results in administrative access, which allows arbitrary changes to.php files. This is related to wp-admin/includes/ajax-actions.php andwp-includes/comment.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9787` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.1.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.1.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.1.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.1.1+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 5.1.1+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.1+dfsg1-1').
